abstract: Ecuadorian Pres Rafael Correa warns of possibility that oil prices will experience steep rise if they continue to remain low for much longer, as collapse in prices in last year has pushed oil companies to cut exploration and production; makes statement after meeting with Iranian Pres Hassan Rouhani in New York, and expresses pessimism that OPEC will cut production despite low prices.
lead_paragraph: The president, Rafael Correa, said he feared that without price stabilization efforts, the current oil glut could vanish, causing a rise to record price levels.

headline.main: Ecuador’s President Warns of a Surge in Oil Prices
headline.print_headline: Ecuador’s President Predicts an Eventual Surge in Oil Prices

snippet: The president, Rafael Correa, said he feared that without price stabilization efforts, the current oil glut could vanish, causing a rise to record price levels.

keywords.value: Organization of the Petroleum Exporting Countries
keywords.name: organizations
